de.dimensionv.android.androtools

Class BasePreferences

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.dimensionv.android.androtools.BasePreferences
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SharedPreferences, SharedPreferences.Editor, Initializer, MemoryTrimmer

    public abstract class BasePreferences
extends Object
implements SharedPreferences, SharedPreferences.Editor, Initializer, MemoryTrimmer

    Base-class for SharedPreferences handling.

    This base-class implements the SharedPreferences and SharedPreferences.Editor interfaces directly for a more convenient access and easier handling.

    Since this class is using caching mechanisms for certain aspects, it also implements the MemoryTrimmer interface. In order to be properly available after a trim memory event, the Initializer interface is implemented as well, doing necessary initialization.

    Furthermore, this class has support for easily storing string-sets into the properties-file, a feature that is only available from API-Level 11 (Honeycomb) and later. If the appropriate API-Level is detected during runtime, the "native" method for storing string sets will be used, otherwise the "support-implementation" introduced by this class will be used.
    In order to be backwards compatible for devices that get updated from an API-Level below 11 to an API-Level of 11 or above, this implementation can detect that previously the old routines were used, and will silently make a transition to the new native routines.

    Since:
    API 1.0.0

      • settings

      • editor

        protected SharedPreferences.Editor editor
        An editor object used internally to write the preferences and finally commit/apply them. It needs to be aquired through getEditor(), and will be released by calling apply() or commit().
        Since:
        Class 1.0, API 1.0.0

      • getHash

        protected String getHash(String value)

        Aquires the hash for the given value.

        This method checks the keyMap first if the value has already been hashed before, and only if that's not the case, attempts to compute a new hash of the value.
        If possible, the SHA1-Algorithm will be used for hashing. Should that fail, a the simple standard String.hashCode() method will be used.

        In case the value has been hashed before, it will be taken from the in-memory cache.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to be hashed.
        Returns:
        The hash-value as a hexadecimal String.
        Since:
        Class 1.0, API 1.0.0

      • getKeyMap

        protected HashMap<String,String> getKeyMap()

        Returns the keyMap cache.

        In case it wasn't instantiated, yet, this method will take care of that.

        Returns:
        The keyMap cache
        Since:
        Class 1.0, API 1.0.0

      • onTrim

        public void onTrim()
        Description copied from interface: MemoryTrimmer

        Relaxed release of memory

        This is the method that should be called from Application.ActivityLifecycleCallbacks#onTrimMemory(int) on a level like Application.ActivityLifecycleCallbacks#TRIM_MEMORY_BACKGROUND.
        Though this is not mandatory, and this method can be run at any level, it is recommended to have this method run at a lower level than the MemoryTrimmer.onForceTrim() method.

        Specified by:
        onTrim in interface MemoryTrimmer

      • onForceTrim

        public void onForceTrim()
        Description copied from interface: MemoryTrimmer

        Strict release of all not strictly necessary memory resources.

        The call to this method should also ensure that all resources that would be freed by MemoryTrimmer.onTrim() are definitely freed.

        This is the method that should be called from Application.ActivityLifecycleCallbacks#onLowMemory() or preferrably from Application.ActivityLifecycleCallbacks#onTrimMemory(int) with the Application.ActivityLifecycleCallbacks#TRIM_MEMORY_COMPLETE level.

        Specified by:
        onForceTrim in interface MemoryTrimmer
